org.conqat.engine.resource.text.filter.util

Class StringOffsetTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.engine.resource.text.filter.util.StringOffsetTransformer

  • public class StringOffsetTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
    A transformation class for filtering strings. This class can perform forward transformation of string (i.e. delete the corresponding parts) and backwards transformation of offsets. The transformation itself is initialized by a list of deletions.

    The transformation is represented by two arrays of corresponding offsets into both the filtered and unfiltered (raw) string. These offsets are stored for all end positions of a deletion.

    • Method Detail

      • filterString

        public java.lang.String filterString(java.lang.String s)
        Returns the string after transformation.

      • getUnfilteredOffset

        public int getUnfilteredOffset(int offset)
        Converts a filtered offset to an unfiltered offset.

      • getFilteredOffset

        public int getFilteredOffset(int unfilteredOffset)
        Converts an unfiltered offset to a filtered offset. If the offset was filtered, the first offset after the filtered region is returned (which might be one after the last offset in the filtered string, if the provided offset in a filtered tail region).

      • isFilteredOffset

        public boolean isFilteredOffset(int offset)
        Returns whether an offset is contained in a deleted region.

      • isFilterGapBetween

        public boolean isFilterGapBetween(int firstOffset,
                                  int secondOffset)
        Returns whether there is a filtering gap between the two offsets. The first offset must be strictly smaller than the second offset. Both offsets should be "filtered offsets".

      • extractFilteredRegions

        public java.util.List<Region> extractFilteredRegions()
        Extracts the filtered regions from this transformer.
